cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 210 mi (340 km) SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the NW Caribbean today, turning north over the south-central Gulf Tuesday and accelerating north-northeast toward the northern Gulf Coast (LA–MS/AL) by Wednesday

weather_observation.watch_coast: None currently in effect for the U.S. coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: None currently in effect for the U.S. coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward across Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are possible at Pascagoula with a 44% cumulative probability, highest late Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Zeta approaches just west of the port, surge of roughly 2–4 ft above ground is possible along the Mississippi coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 6 inches could cause localized flooding at the port Wednesday–Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands and short-notice squalls could disrupt cargo operations.
